Probabilistic Classification Models
▪ There is a need to not only predict class labels, but also provide 
a measure of confidence associated with every prediction
▪ They use probability theory to represent the relationship 
between attributes and class labels
– It offers a systematic way for quantifying uncertainty in data
– An appealing framework for assessing the confidence of predictions
▪ Naïve Bayes classifier
– One of the simplest and most widely-used probabilistic classifiers
P(Class label = Purchase | Salary = 5000, Age = 21, Gender = “Male”) = ?
18
